ACCOAC.rxnNotes:
A biotinyl-protein.
Step 1: biotin + ATP + HCO3 -> carboxy-biotin + ADP + Pi. 
Step 2: carboxy-biotin + ACCOA -> MALCOA
bacteria have separate enzymes for each step and a biotin-carrier protein; in yeast a single protein carries out all activities

ARTCOAL1.rxnNotes:
HR fatty acid metabolism - R groups = acyl groups, Rtotal, Rtotal2, Rtotal3 correspond to three possible acyl groups added to glycerol
Carbon stoichiometry normalized wrt C16
R1 - C16 groups
R2 - essential FA + associated derivatives
R3 - non-essential, dietary FA (C18)
R4 - monounsaturated FA
R5 -other (C26, C24)

ARTFR11.rxnNotes:
Carbon stoichiometry normalized wrt C16:0
The concomitant oxidation of fadh2 is to account for the normalization to a saturated fatty acid (later in the mitochondria, the full beta oxidation cycle will occur, and the additional round of fad reduction will be balanced to account for the respective degree of desaturation). For example a 9,15 fatty acid would have 2fadh2(m) -> 2fad(m).
The concomittant exchange for nadph is to account for cases in which the fatty acid has alternating odd and even double bonds (all human fatty acids?). For example a 9,12 fatty acid would have: fadh2(m) + nadph(m) + h(m) -> fad(m) + nadp(m). The nadph is from 2,4 dienoyl-CoA reductase (human gene: DECR1, gene ID 1666). PMID 7818482 (Koivuranta et al 1994) identified this as a mitochondrial gene, Voet and Voet claim this is peroxisomal (not directly supported with primary literature, so it is presumed to be mitochondrial).
For all of the R-group reactions which lead to subsequent fatty acid oxidation, 3,2 enoyl-CoA isomerase activity (human gene: DCI, gene ID 1632) is "inherently" incorporated into the reactions. 
R1 - C16 groups
R2 - essential FA + associated derivatives
R3 - non-essential, dietary FA (C18)
R4 - monounsaturated FA
R5 -other (C26, C24)
NJ

PMID 7818482 (Koivuranta et al 1994) identified this as a mitochondrial gene, Voet and Voet claim this is peroxisomal (not directly supported with primary literature, so it is presumed to be mitochondrial).
For all of the R-group reactions which lead to subsequent fatty acid oxidation, 3,2 enoyl-CoA isomerase activity (human gene: DCI, gene ID 1632) is "inherently" incorporated into the reactions.

For example a 9,12 fatty acid would have: fadh2(m) + nadph(m) + h(m) -> fad(m) + nadp(m). The nadph is from 2,4 dienoyl-CoA reductase (human gene: DECR1, gene ID 1666). PMID 7818482 (Koivuranta et al 1994) identified this as a mitochondrial gene, Voet and Voet claim this is peroxisomal (not directly supported with primary literature, so it is presumed to be mitochondrial).
For all of the R-group reactions which lead to subsequent fatty acid oxidation, 3,2 enoyl-CoA isomerase activity (human gene: DCI, gene ID 1632) is "inherently" incorporated into the reactions. 
R1 - C16 groups
R2 - essential FA + associated derivatives
R3 - non-essential, dietary FA (C18)
R4 - monounsaturated FA
R5 -other (C26, C24)
NJ

SAB
This reaction represents the ATP driven secretion of dopa from the cell.  It leaves out the vesicle because that is not a compartment.  ATP:H ratio is assumed as 1:3 for vacuolar ATPase and substrate:h ratio is 1:2.  This gives a 3:2 ratio for substrate:ATP
DOPAVESSEC.rxnNames: Dopamine secretion via secretory vesicle (ATP driven)

NACHEXA10ly.rxnNotes:
Note that this reaction is specific to beta-N-acetylhexosaminidase A and cannot be catalyzed by beta-N-acetylhexosaminidase B (or presumably beta-N-acetylhexosaminidase S). This is also a lumped reaction, representing the cleavage of GalNAc4S or GalNAc6S and N-acetylgalactosamine 4-sulfatase or 6-sulfatase.
NCD

Many nucleoside diphosphates (eight described) can act as acceptors. 
While many ribo- and deoxyribonucleoside triphosphates can act as donors, only ATP is chosen as a donor to minimize the number of total reactions.

SAB

UDPtl.rxnNotes:
unknown mechanism for transport - not known if it is energy dependent or not, recycling and IC transport is important to get it to other areas of the cell (e.g. plasma membrane) - translocators have been found for ER and Golgi - none found for lysosome yet so non-mechanistic transporter added - in future this will need to be revised _when_ a translocator is found
